meanings.sent1: By following the rules, you are legitimising your actions.
meanings.sent2: The government is legitimising the new law with the approval of the parliament.
meanings.sent3: Legitimising your parking spot with a toy car won't fool anyone.
meanings.sent4: Her signature on the document was like legitimising its importance.
meanings.sent5: The stamp of approval was the final step in legitimising the contract.

meanings.definition: To give authority or justification to.
meanings.sent1: The judge's decision legitimises the evidence presented in court.
meanings.sent2: Parents play a crucial role in legitimising their children's behavior.
meanings.sent3: Legitimising a late-night snack as a healthy choice is wishful thinking.
meanings.sent4: His confident demeanor legitimised his position as a leader.
meanings.sent5: The trophy on the shelf legitimised all her hard work and dedication.

meanings.sent1: The official stamp will legitimise the document.
meanings.sent2: The committee's decision legitimised the project proposal.
meanings.sent3: Legitimising a fake ID won't get you into the club.
meanings.sent4: Her smile legitimised her acceptance of the invitation.
meanings.sent5: The certificate of achievement legitimised his success in the competition.
